content.description:
This route starts on the 1st 4 bolts of

The Scene Is Not For Sale

. After the 4th bolt head left past a tricky, hard boulder problem (crux) to pull onto the blunt arete and difficult climbing above.
Short and steep. Climb the slightly right leaning face, past bolts on beautiful redish rock .
content.location: 30' to the right of The Last Coyote. Scramble to the base of this tricky slightly overhanging route.

climbs.name: The Scene Is Not For Sale

content.description:
Starts right of center and just right of

Crossfire

(5.12a) with bouldery moves past the first bolt. Once the crux is dispatched the climbing is very enjoyable, with fairly continuous climbing on large, positive holds for the most part. Long and continuous, this climb works well as a warm-up for the harder lines on the wall.

This route starts down and left around the corner from

Crossfire

, on the south east face, off a terrace with a large rock to sit on and just right of

Improbable

. Head up 4 bolts and then left under a blocky roof then up past 5 more bolts. The chimney to the left is strictly off route. Clippig the 5th bolt and climbing past it, is the crux. Long draws on the 1st 3 bolts will help with rope drag.
Steep moves thru huecos past several bolts to a ledge, to another steep section on edges, passing several more bolts to the anchors.
content.location: Walk to the right of the main Crossfire crag wall 50' to the right and slightly up hill along the base of the cliff. Scramble up to a ledge to the base of this route.

content.description: Furthest left most route on Crossfire Crag's southern wall.  This route is described in the guide book with two stars although I'm not sure why.  The first third of the route in a bit chossy and as you gain elevation the route continues in an uneventful fashion.  Good enough while in the area but compared to other routes in the area does not earn the two stars as indicated in guide.
content.protection: 5 bolts to large closed shut anchors.
content.location: Furthest left most route on Crossfire crag with southern exposure.

content.description: Route starts on broken corner just up and left of the chimney.  Start on slabby section and move upward following bolt line.  3rd and 4th bolts provide a bit steeper section with good clipping stances continue up to slightly bulging top out.
content.location: Second route from left on southern side of crag and just left of chimney section.  SCSG 3rd edition route 777

content.description:
This route starts on the same 1st 4 bolts as

The Possibility

(5.11c/d), then head right and up on steep rock, past 4 more bolt to a chain anchor that is on the right side of the arete.

Double Kneebar Ranch starts to the left of

Crossfire

(5.12a). Steep, overhead slaps, underclings, kneebars, heelhooking. Local classic.
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts to a chain anchor.

content.description: Difficult start. Slap the sloping arete and slap again for a hidden-edge-like feature. Clipping the second bolt is the first crux. Getting out of the underclings in the hueco up higher is the second crux. You'll need power and endurance to finish off.
content.location:
Left of

The Scene Is Not For Sale

(5.10d); start on a boulder.

content.description: Start up using smooth softball sized huecos moving up and right.  3rd bolt section is a bit greasy.  Midway you cross over a small roof which is bolt protected and continue to summit.
content.location: Right most line on east face of Crossfire Crag and just right of arching ramp/crack.  SCSG 3rd edition route 785

content.description:
This route starts just left of

Double Kneebar Ranch

(5.12b/c). Climb steep reachy rock thru pockets, side pulls, underclings to a hard crux. Best to belay below, from the ledge that

Evil Offspring

starts from.
